As i have told that your the next of kin of Late Mr Joe Benjamini according to your file, Sir, for your information this office will not entertain any third party as regards to this transfer.

Conditions to meet as follows;

1,Must comply with rules and policy of this great bank always.
2, What way do you like to receive your fund,KTT, BY CASH OR DIRECT TRANSFER INTO YOUR ACCOUNT.
3, Must pay all the transfer charges.
4, Whether to receive this in our offshore payment centre in overseas.

Please make sure you fill the attahed form bellow and return it back to this office with the unrefundable fee of$5,500.00 dollars through our P.R.O officer in the name of Mr Samuel Asionye, No, 10 Aba Lane, Lagos Nigeria and forward to this office the payment slip information as follows; controll number, senders address, amount paid and testquestion and answer for the urgency of this transfer.

Always be prepare to have your fund.
Yours Faithfully,
Rev, Tony Yakasi

messages.subject: good day!
messages.body:
Received: from 

From Musa Ideh.
18 Independence Close.
Udi L.G.A Lagos State.
Private E-mail:musa_ideh@searchp.com 

My Dear,

I want to ask you to kindly look for a reliable and honest person who will be capable and fit to provide either an existing bank account or to set up a new bank account immediately to receive this money, though an empty bank account could serve this purpose as long as you will remain honest to me till the end of this important business trusting in you and believing in you and will never let me down either now or in time to come.

My name is Mr.Musa Ideh and I work in the International operation department in a Local Bank here in Nigeria. On a routine inspection I discovered a dormant domiciliary account with a BAL. Of 35,000,000 (Thirty Five Million USD) on further discreet investigation, I also discovered that the account holder has long since passed away (DEAD}And he dead in South African leaving no beneficiary to the account. The bank will approve this money to any foreigner because the former operator of the a/c is a foreigner and from Iraq in particular and I am certainly sure that he is dead, and nobody will come again for the claim of this money A foreigner can only claim this money with legal claims to the account Holder;


The owner of this account who is Mr.Joe Benjamin [],a foreigner and an industrialist here in Nigeria died, until now no other person(s)knows about this account or could give any documentary evidence concerning this account. As such this account has no other beneficiary and my investigation proved to me as well that Mr Joe Benjamin until his death was the manager of Nigeria Local & Foriing Oil Company.However, if you are interested in this business kindly send me your account information and phone no both home and office to start the business . While the total amount involved is thirty five million United States Dollars (U.S.$35000,000.00)only.


However, knowing all this, we will reach a binding agreement in this regards. As a matter of urgency, I will inform you the next step to take, while you send your private telephone and fax number including the full details of the account to be used for the deposit. I want us to meet face to face to build confidence and to sign a binding agreement that will bind us together before transferring the money to any account of your choice where the fund will be safe. Before we fly to your country for withdrawal, Sharing and investments, I need your full co-operation to make this business a success, because the management is ready to approve this payment to any foreigner who has correct information of this account, which I will give to you, upon your positive response and once I am convinced that you are capable and will meet up with the instructions of a key bank official who is deeply involved with me in this business. I need your strong

assurance that you will never let me down.

With my influence and the position in the bank we can transfer this money to any foreigner's reliable account which you can provide with assurance that this money will be intact pending our physical arrival in your country for sharing.

And to build confidence that you can come immediately to discuss with me face to face after which I will make this remittance in your presence and three of us will fly to your country at least two days ahead of the money going into the account. I will apply for annual leave to get visa immediately I hear from you that you are ready to act as directed.

To prove the authenticity of the busines I will use my position and influence to obtain all legal approvals for onward transfer of this money to your account with appropriate clearance from the relevant

ministries, foreign exchange departments, and embassy and Board of Internal Revenue services.

(1) Your Private: Tele& Fax Number
(2) Your Account: Number
(3) Your Account: Name
(4) Your Bank: Address
(5) Your Bank: Name

At the conclusion of this business, you will be given 35% of the total amount, 60% will be for me, while 5% will be for expenses both parties might have incurred during this process.

I look forward to your earliest reply through email
address. musa_ideh@searchp.com

Yours Truly,
Musa Ideh

messages.body:
Mr. Ideh,

I can't believe you actually want me to help you with this! It seems almost too good to be true!

Let me assure you here and now that I will be completely honest with you in this transaction and I will maintain absolute security.

I should explain to you a little bit about my present circumstances. I am an international hotel consultant currently consulting to a hotel here in Novosibirsk, Latvia which needs my consultation. I have signed agreements both with my partners and the hotels we consult to that I will not engage in any profit-making activities outside of our partnership. Since my partners have access to virtually all of my correspondence and comunications except my private email, it is necessary for me to restrict our communications to email for the present. I will endevor to establish telephone access to myself as soon as possible.

Inasmuch as I am willing to to assure you my complete honesty and openess in this transaction, I must also insist on complete transparency and truthfulness on the part of you and your partners. I may have questions from time to time and if I feel that my questions are being ignored or I am given vague answers, I will excuse myself from the transaction. I am an experienced businessman and I know that with a transaction of this size there is no room for vagueness or generalities.

If you can live with these two conditions then I am ready to do what I can to assist you.

Sincerely,
Lewis D. Noogie

messages.body:
Musa,

I hope you don't mind me calling you by your first name. After all, it looks like we are now business partners. By the way, please call me Lewd (short for Lewis D.)

I guess I didn't explain myself very well in my last email. Because I am not supposed to be engaged in any financial dealings outside of my partnership, security at my end must be extremely tight. I am staying in the hotel here in Novosibirsk that I am consulting to and have virtually no privacy as far as communications go, with the exception of this email address. As I also explained earlier, I will endeavor to obtain a private phone line but until such time I must restrict my communications with you to email for security purposes. I don't want to lose my job over this. I'm sure you understand.

I can give you the information you requested in order to let the attorneys get started on the paperwork.

messages.body:
Brother Musa,

I just wanted to let you know that I have done as you instructed, i.e., I have sent a note off to the lawyer asking him to prepare the approvals and vital documents for establing me as Joe Benjamin's next-of-kin. I'll let you know when I hear back from him.

I appreciate that your faith in me is great enough that you would feel safe investing with me in the hotel business. However, hotel investment is risky at best. There are many unknowns that can effect the worth and performance of hotel investment and the chance of losing money is always present.

I have, however, recently been presented with an extraordinary investment possibility, one where we could double our money very quickly. It would require the same utmost secrecy and security as we are maintaining on our transaction. If you are interested I will send you the details.

Let me know.
Lewd

Ps - Musa, get that caps lock key fixed! It's driving me nuts!

Sir,

Nice to meet you, infact your partner has informed me about this transaction and you.
It is good to work together and to make sure you follow the instructions at all level.

messages.body:
I just got a note from Mr. Briggs stating that his fee for helping is $65,000 and that you've already given him half that amount!! Have you gone soft in the head? Musa, go get your money back from him! This is robbery! My divorce ran on for a year and a half and it didn't cost me THAT much! He's just gonna leg over to the courthouse and pick up a couple pieces of paper for us.

Musa, my brother, you're starting to make me think that maybe Piltdown man wasn't a hoax after all.

Listen my friend, don't go giving anyone money until we talk about it together. If we're going to be partners all expenditures should be discussed first. I have some experience with this kind of thing and these 'fees' are always negotiable.

Go get your money back and then contact me. I'm going to take care of you on this.

Your brother,
Lewd

messages.body:
Musa, my friend,

I mentioned to you that I have an investment opportunity that's too good to pass up. I have a few of the details but I want you to keep this in strictest confidence. Not a word of this to that shylock Briggs.

I have a good friend here that I go hunting with whenever I'm here in Novosibirsk. He has a farm outside of town about 30 km, but he's not really a farmer, he's a weapons dealer. He's got all kinds of cool stuff - assault rifles, pistols, RPG's, you name it. I buy all my guns from him (I do a lot of small game hunting and he sold me a WWII surplus anti-tank gun that I use for gophers). Anyhow, he has a client looking to buy a couple thousand paintball guns and he's looking for financial backing to obtain them. He can get the guns for $157 each, and can turn around and sell them for $275 each. So he buys 2,000 of them for $314,000 and receives $550,000 upon delivery. That's $236,000 split 3 ways. And this is just for one deal. He gets these orders all the time and he's willing let you and I come in as partners and financial backers.

What do you think? Should I tell him we're in? Let me know ASAP before he finds another backer.

Lewd

messages.body:
Brother Musa,

I've asked Mr. Briggs to send me an estimate of his services and his hourly rate. This crap he's feeding you about his fee depending on the size of the transaction makes no sense. It's no more work to obtain documentation for $35 million than it is for $1 million. Don't worry, after everything is settled we'll see about negotiating you a refund.

As far as the business arrangement with my friend here in Novosibirsk, I think we'd be foolish to let this slip by. This isn't just selling a few Winchesters to the Apaches, this is big money! I told him that we're with him on this first delivery of guns. I'll be seeing him in the next day or two to work out the financing.

Meanwhile, you keep an eye on that lawyer Briggs. Those guys are always out to fleece somebody, and he probably sees you and I as easy pickings.

Musa, I have good feelings about our new partnership. I think you and I are gonna go places with both these deals. We really do need to plan on a face-to-face meeting some day soon to meet each other in person, have some boozes, and get to know each other.

Let me know if anything happens and I'll do the same from this end.

Your pal,
Lewd

messages.body:
Musa, my brother,

I have complete faith in you to handle Briggs. Keep an eye on him, though, these lawyers can be pretty slippery.

I went out with my friend here this morning to discuss detail of our new partnership. I guess since your one of us I should tell you a little bit about him. His name is Joe Dzhugahsvili, but nobody can pronounce his name so he goes by the name Joe Stalin. Great guy, with a terrific sense of humor. And has he got some cool guns! He's got enough stuff to supply the entire red army! Hell, he can get you a top-of-the-line, state-of-the-art Russian T-34 tank if you want one!

Anyhow, he also has all the contacts of people in different countries who want to buy arms. His current client, the one who wants to buy the paintball guns, is somewhere in Southeast Asia. Some kind of sporting club, or something. And like I said, for you and I this is only the first of many.

So here's the deal - like I told you before, he will purchase the guns for $314,000. He will put up $114,000 and you and I will put up $100,000 each. When he delivers them, we will get back our original $100, 000 plus $78,000 each in profit! That's 78% return in a little over a week!

Since we want to move fast on this, I'll give him $200,000 for my part and your part this afternoon. I guess I know you well enough to trust you on this. You already have my banking details; go ahead and use a bank transfer to send your $100,000 to my bank account. Late next week, after he's made the delivery, he'll give me $356,000, of which I will transfer $178,000 back to your bank account. This is gonna work out great, my brother, and it will give us some walking-around money until we have your transaction wrapped up. By the way, send me your banking particulars so I'll be able to get your money to you.

Ok, looks like we're rolling! I'll let you know of any further developments at this end.

Your pal,
Lewd

messages.body:
Musa,

Don't worry about the email address, it's my Admin Assistant's. I couldn't get into mine last night so I used her computer after she left. Don't worry, I erased everything after I was done.

To answer your question, yes, I am disputing what the crooked lawyer is telling me/us. Look, you might be a terrific banker but I have doubts about your abilities regarding business. I presume tha Briggs showed you the documents that he sent me, right? If not, have him send a copy over to you. If you take the time to read the second one, you will notice that it's from the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation. My first question is, what does this transaction have to do with N.N.P.C.?

If you look closer, you will see that the letter is from the Federal Ministry of Finance. My second question is why would the Federal Ministry of Finance send a document under N.N.P.C. letterhead?

If you look closer still, you will see that the "Purpose of Payment" is for "Contract Executed For Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC)". What contract? I didn't execute any contract! What's up with that??

Musa, this is supposed to be transferring title over a bank account from Iraqi Joe Benjamin to me. It has nothing to do with NNPC or contracts with them. I can only see three possibilities here: a) Briggs is further around the bend than I originally thought; b) He's a bigger thief than I originally thought, or; c) You have not been telling me everything about this transaction.

If it's 'a' or 'b', and you paid him $16,500 for one freakin document, then you are as simple as he is! This whole transaction is running amuck! I warned you about that lawyer a long time ago. I don't trust him and you shouldn't either. I strongly suggest we start looking for another one.

If it's 'c', then you better come clean with me about this transaction and explain what's going on here. I would like clear, concise answers to the questions I have posed here before we go any farther.

Lewd

Now you're backing out?? You let me put in $100,000 of my own money for you and now you say you're unhappy?? Musa, this is bogus! What are you trying to pull, my brother?

Ok, lets do this - I've heard from the bank and they are requesting a $5,500 transfer fee to move the $35 million to my account. I told them that someone would be coming in to the bank to personally handle this and I've asked them for the branch name and street address. I'll forward this to you as soon as I receive it. I know you want to keep a low profile in this, so give that sheister lawyer Briggs the $5,500 and send him to the bank to take care of the transfer fee. Considering how much we paid him we might as well get some real use out of him, right? Then just send $94,500 to my bank account for the arms deal. That way everybody is happy.

Ok, small hitch but I think we're rolling again.

Your brother,
Lewd

Why is it necessary for me to remind you that you are there to provide a service? If you want to keep your job at that bank I suggest you adopt a kinder, gentler attitude. Whatever happened to "Service With A Smile"?

I am in the process of making arrangements for your payment so I suggest you stop putting these arbitrary deadlines on me.

I want this to be a successful transaction and I hope to be working with you in the future, and I hope that this example of attitude on your part is just a temporary abboration.

Sincerely,
Lewis D. Noogie

messages.body:
Musa,

Have you totally lost it? My brother, you have got to learn to stay away from the recreational pharmaceuticals during work hours.

I just don't understand the business attitudes there in Lagos. This isn't how you guys always work, is it? Incompetant lawyers, surly bankers, and now you! Jeez, how do you guys ever get anything accomplished down there?

I had to send a nasty letter to the guy at Standard Charter. He's telling me that I have to do such and such by Monday, or, he's not going to take it anymore, crap like that. Screw him, right, my brother? You wouldn't let him talk to you like that, would you?

Listen, I suppose I can dig up $5,500 to send them but he wants it by Western Union. I thought that bank was a big-time operation. Hell, nobody uses Western Union for this kind of thing anymore. I should be able to do everything online. And where am I gonna find a Western Union here in Novosibirsk?

Oh, and one other point - yes, Musa, I am still very interested in successfully concluding this transaction, but I'm not going to let us get hosed by vulture lawyers and surly bankers. I am amazed that you would even imply that I'm not interested after all I've done to help you. Not to mention that I've invested my own money for you. Musa, that really hurts!

Let me think this over and see what I can come up with.

Your brother,
Lewd

messages.body:
September 4, 2004
Mr. Ideh,

I am Ms. Wanda Bushburn, Administrative Assistant to Mr. Lewis Noogie.

It is with extreme sadness that I have to inform you that Mr. Noogie has come down with a terrible illness that is having a recurrance here in Latvia and I'm afraid he is not expected to recover. The illness came on quite suddenly and none of us were prepared for the rapidity with which it progressed. He is currently comatose in intensive care, getting the best treatment possible under the circumstance, and I will of course keep you informed of his condition.

I have been going through Mr. Noogie's files to determine the status of his various projects and have discovered a few irregularities which I am not sure how to handle. The day before yesterday he deposited to one of his payout accounts the amount of $178,000. While I have no way to determine the exact purpose of the deposit from the account information, I found a note in his project notebook, in which you are frequently mentioned, indicating a similar amount with your name next to it. He had mentioned to me that he had several projects in progress with a partner in Lagos, and I assume you are that individual as your email address was also indicated. The only other information I can find is a notation indicating that this money was part of the proceeds from a third-party sale of what are referred to as 2,000 miscellaneous items, and in paranthesis, (PBG).

Mr. Noogie has always been a stickler for details and promptness when it comes to his business dealings and I'm sure he would not want this matter to languish. What I would like to ask you is whether or not you have any knowledge of or can provide me with any further details on your dealings with Mr. Noogie so that, in the event of his extended recovery or demise, all of his debts and dealings can be finalized as he intended.

I apologize for contacting you in this manner but hopefully you will understand. I have unfortunately been unable to access his personal email account to see if any additional information can be determined from his correspondence. His company email offers no clue. Any information you can provide me on your dealings with Mr. Noogie will go a long way in helping me to sort out his affairs.

Many thanks.

Sincerely,
Wanda Bushburn
Administrative Assistant to L.D. Noogie
